column4: Hello all.. just a quick question regarding open source, if someone has a minute and doesn't mind an off topic question! someone is making the argument that making the source code available for software, browsers for example, makes it open to security risks.. i kind of understand the argument against but can't quite put it into words
are you looking at the pros or the cons of having the source freely and publicly available?
as johnnybezak and Zanz-2 have both stated, having the source available corresponds to security-savvy open source programmers patching the vulnerabilities much faster
well, to be pedantic toward the guy with whom you're conversing, firefox relies on external (system) libssl
